org.gwt.mosaic.ui.client
Class ColumnWidget

java.lang.Object
  com.google.gwt.user.client.ui.UIObject
      com.google.gwt.user.client.ui.Widget
          com.google.gwt.user.client.ui.Composite
              org.gwt.mosaic.ui.client.LayoutComposite
                  org.gwt.mosaic.ui.client.ColumnWidget
All Implemented Interfaces:
com.google.gwt.user.client.EventListener, HasLayoutManager
Direct Known Subclasses:
ScrollTable, ScrollTreeTable
public abstract class ColumnWidget
extends LayoutComposite

A ColumnWidget consists of a fixed header and footer (both optional) that remain visible and a scrolltable body that contains the data.

In order for the columns in the header table and the data table to line up, the two table must have the same margin, padding, and border widths. You can use CSS style sheets to manipulate the colors and styles of the cell's, but you must keep the actual sizes consistent (especially with respect to the left and right side of the cells).

CSS Style Rules

  • .gwt-ScrollTable { applied to the entire widget }
  • .gwt-ScrollTable .headerTable { applied to the header table }
  • .gwt-ScrollTable .dataTable { applied to the data table }
  • .gwt-ScrollTable .footerTable { applied to the footer table }
  • .gwt-ScrollTable .headerWrapper { wrapper around the header table }
  • .gwt-ScrollTable .dataWrapper { wrapper around the data table }
  • .gwt-ScrollTable .footerWrapper { wrapper around the footer table }

Author:
georgopoulos.georgios(at)gmail.com

applySortedColumnIndicator

protected void applySortedColumnIndicator(com.google.gwt.user.client.Element tdElem,
                                          boolean ascending)
Apply the sorted column indicator to a specific table cell in the header table.

Parameters:
tdElem - the cell in the header table, or null to remove it
ascending - true to apply the ascending indicator, false for descending

fillWidth

public void fillWidth()
Adjust all column width so they take up the maximum amount of space without needing a horizontal scroll bar. The distribution will be proportional to the current width of each column. The ColumnWidget must be visible on the page for this method to work.

scrollTables

protected void scrollTables(boolean baseHeader)
Sets the scroll property of the header and data wrappers when scrolling so that the header, footer, and data tables line up.

Parameters:
baseHeader - If true, use the header as the alignment source

setColumnSortable

public void setColumnSortable(int column,
                              boolean sortable)
Enable or disable sorting on a specific column. All columns are sortable by default. Use setSortingEnabled(boolean) to disable sorting on all columns.

Parameters:
column - the index of the column
sortable - true to enable sorting for this column, false to disable

setColumnWidth

public int setColumnWidth(int column,
                          int width)
Set the width of a column. If the column has already been set using the setGuaranteedColumnWidth(int, int) method, the column will no longer have a guaranteed column width.

Parameters:
column - the index of the column
width - the width in pixels
Returns:
the new column width

setColumnWidth

public int setColumnWidth(int column,
                          int width,
                          int sacrificeColumn)
Set the width of a column.

Parameters:
column - the index of the column
width - the width in pixels
sacrificeColumn - the column that will be shrunk to maintain the width
Returns:
the new column width

setFooterTable

public void setFooterTable(com.google.gwt.widgetideas.table.client.FixedWidthFlexTable footerTable)
Set the footer table that appears under the data table. If set to null, the footer table will not be shown.

Parameters:
footerTable - the table to use in the footer

setGuaranteedColumnWidth

public int setGuaranteedColumnWidth(int column,
                                    int width)
Set the width of a column and guarantees that the width will not change, regardless of the resize policy.

Parameters:
column - the index of the column
width - the width in pixels
Returns:
the new column width

setMinWidth

public void setMinWidth(int minWidth)
Set the minimum allowable width of the data table. If the width of this Widget is smaller than the width of the data table, a horizontal scroll bar will appear. The minWidth property only applies to the policy ResizePolicy#FILL_WIDTH.

Parameters:
minWidth - the minimum width, or -1 to disable

setResizePolicy

public void setResizePolicy(ColumnWidget.ResizePolicy resizePolicy)
Set the resize policy of the table.

Parameters:
resizePolicy - the resize policy

setScrollPolicy

public void setScrollPolicy(ColumnWidget.ScrollPolicy scrollPolicy)
Set the scroll policy of the table.

Parameters:
scrollPolicy - the new scroll policy

setSortingEnabled

public void setSortingEnabled(boolean sortingEnabled)
Enable or disable column sorting via mouse clicks to the header cells.

Parameters:
sortingEnabled - true to enable column sorting via mouse events
